channel.title: NPR Topics: Science
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Can't solve a puzzle? Sleep on it, a new study suggests
item.description: NPR's Short Wave talks about babies' perceptions of rhythm, how sleep may help us solve puzzles and why snakes may be able to fast so long.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Short Wave talks about babies' perceptions of rhythm, how sleep may help us solve puzzles and why snakes may be able to fast so long.
item.dc:creator: Regina G. Barber

item.title: The Winter Olympics in Italy were meant to be sustainable. Are they?
item.description: Italy's Winter Olympics promised sustainability. But in Cortina, environmentalists warn the Games could scar these mountains for decades.
item.content:encoded:
Italy's Winter Olympics promised sustainability. But in Cortina, environmentalists warn the Games could scar these mountains for decades.

(Image credit: Valerio Muscella for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Measles continues to spread in the US, but with some letup
item.description: As South Carolina's outbreak grows to 876 confirmed cases, vaccinations in the state surged in January. Cases have also been reported in two ICE detention facilities.
item.content:encoded:
As South Carolina's outbreak grows to 876 confirmed cases, vaccinations in the state surged in January. Cases have also been reported in two ICE detention facilities.

(Image credit: The Washington Post via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Searching for dinosaur secrets in crocodile bones
item.description: Until now, estimating how old a dinosaur was when it died has been a fairly simple process: Count up the growth rings in the fossilized bones. But new research into some of dinosaurs' living relatives, like crocodiles, suggests that this method may not always work.
item.content:encoded:
Until now, estimating how old a dinosaur was when it died has been a fairly simple process: Count up the growth rings in the fossilized bones. But new research into some of dinosaurs' living relatives, like crocodiles, suggests that this method may not always work.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: How a Black fossil digger became a superstar in the very white world of paleontology
item.description: In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.
item.content:encoded:
In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: NASA delays the launch of Artemis II lunar mission by at least a month
item.description: NASA is targeting March for the launch of four astronauts on a ten-day mission to circle the moon and return safely to Earth, traveling farther than any humans have ventured in deep space.
item.content:encoded:
NASA is targeting March for the launch of four astronauts on a ten-day mission to circle the moon and return safely to Earth, traveling farther than any humans have ventured in deep space.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Scientists release a map of the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like
item.description: Dark matter makes up most of the universe, yet we have very little understanding of it. Scientists recently released a map that gives the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like.
item.content:encoded: Dark matter makes up most of the universe, yet we have very little understanding of it. Scientists recently released a map that gives the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: The method for estimating a dinosaurs' age at death may be off, research suggests
item.description: A growing body of research on dinosaurs' closest living relatives suggests the method that's been used to estimate how old a dinosaur was when it died may be leading paleontologists astray.
item.content:encoded: A growing body of research on dinosaurs' closest living relatives suggests the method that's been used to estimate how old a dinosaur was when it died may be leading paleontologists astray.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: The Trump administration exempts new nuclear reactors from environmental review
item.description: The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Meet Milo and Tina, the 'first openly Gen Z' Olympic mascots
item.description: The 2026 Olympics and Paralympics mascots are Milo and Tina, a pair of teenage, scarf-clad stoat siblings with big dreams. If you're wondering what a stoat is, you're in the right place.
item.content:encoded:
The 2026 Olympics and Paralympics mascots are Milo and Tina, a pair of teenage, scarf-clad stoat siblings with big dreams. If you're wondering what a stoat is, you're in the right place.

(Image credit: Gabriel Bouys)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
